Maszt_radiowy_w_Konstantynowie.jpg)](/wiki/File:Maszt_radiowy_w_Konstantynowie.jpg)

[](/wiki/File:Maszt_radiowy_w_Konstantynowie.jpg "Enlarge")

In 1974, the [Warsaw radio tower](/wiki/Warsaw_radio_tower "Warsaw radio
tower") was erected, at 646.38 m (2,121 ft) becoming the tallest structure in
the world of its time. It collapsed in 1991 because an error occurred in
exchanging the [guy-wires](/wiki/Guy-wires "Guy-wires").

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d3/Tallest_Structures_in_the_world.png/220px-
Tallest_Structures_in_the_world.png)](/wiki/File:Tallest_Structures_in_the_world.png)

[](/wiki/File:Tallest_Structures_in_the_world.png "Enlarge")

Tallest Structures in the world.

The tallest structure in the world is the [Burj Khalifa](/wiki/Burj_Khalifa
"Burj Khalifa") [skyscraper](/wiki/Skyscraper "Skyscraper") at 829.8 m (2,722
ft). Listed are the **tallest structures in the world** : guyed masts (such as
telecommunication masts), self supporting towers (such as the [CN
Tower](/wiki/CN_Tower "CN Tower")), skyscrapers (such as the [Willis
Tower](/wiki/Willis_Tower "Willis Tower")), [oil platforms](/wiki/Oil_platform
"Oil platform"), electricity transmission towers, and bridge support towers.
This list is organized by absolute height. See [List of tallest buildings and
structures](/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings_and_structures "List of tallest
buildings and structures"), [List of tallest freestanding
structures](/wiki/List_of_tallest_freestanding_structures "List of tallest
freestanding structures") and [List of tallest
buildings](/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings "List of tallest buildings") and
[List of tallest towers](/wiki/List_of_tallest_towers "List of tallest
towers") for additional information about these types of structures.

##
Terminology[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_tallest_structures&action=edit&section=1
"Edit section: Terminology")]

Terminological and listing criteria follow [Council on Tall Buildings and
Urban Habitat](/wiki/Council_on_Tall_Buildings_and_Urban_Habitat "Council on
Tall Buildings and Urban Habitat") definitions. Guyed masts are differentiated
from towers - the latter not featuring any guy wires or other support
structures; and buildings are differentiated from towers - the former having
at least 50% of occupiable floor space although both are self supporting
structures.

## List by
height[[edit](/w/index.php?title=List_of_tallest_structures&action=edit&section=2
"Edit section: List by height")]

indicates a [structure](/wiki/Nonbuilding_structure "Nonbuilding structure")
that is no longer standing.  
indicates a [guyed mast](/wiki/Guyed_mast "Guyed mast").

  * This list includes structures with a minimum height of 500 metres (1,640 ft) to keep the list to a reasonable length. [List of tallest structures in the world - 300 to 400 metres](/wiki/List_of_tallest_structures_in_the_world_-_300_to_400_metres "List of tallest structures in the world - 300 to 400 metres") and [List of tallest structures in the world - 400 to 500 metres](/wiki/List_of_tallest_structures_in_the_world_-_400_to_500_metres "List of tallest structures in the world - 400 to 500 metres") contain shorter structures.
  * For all structures the pinnacle height is given, so the height of skyscrapers may differ from the values at [List of skyscrapers](/wiki/List_of_skyscrapers "List of skyscrapers").
  * [Tension-leg platforms](/wiki/Tension-leg_platform "Tension-leg platform") are not included.
